results.title: Cesar
results.brief_description:
After his years in the merchant navy Marius runs a garage in Toulon. On the death of her husband, Panisse, Fanny reveals to her adult son Cesariot that Marius is his father. With a liitle help from grandfather Cesar, the lovers of 20 years before are reunited. This final entry in Pagnol’s Marseilles trilogy (preceded by ‘Marius’ and ‘Fanny’) is the only one of the three directed by Pagnol.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Pagnol ; director, Marcel Pagnol ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Willy [Faktorovitch], Roger Ledru ; music, Vincent Scotto.
Cast: Raimu, Pierre Fresnay, Orane Demazis, Ropbert Vattier, Charpin, Maupi.

results.title: Cervical cancer
results.creator_credit: Health Education Video Unit, Leicestershire Health Authority, A Ralph Rosenthal and Russell Kightley
results.brief_description: Details the structure of the cervix and explains why it is particularly vulnerable to external agents. Addresses the high incidence of cervical cancer and recommends preventative strategies.

results.title: Cerveau gele
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rene Jodoin and Pierre Moretti
results.brief_description: Claude Dubois sings out against the petrifying effect of growing cities. The images on the screen form and reform to reflect his sentiments. Music by Claude Dubois and photography by Claude Lapierre.

results.title: Certaines Nouvelles = Certain News
results.brief_description:
Algeria, 1961. Laughter and music escape from an old sea-side house. Helene, Jean and Pierre try to remain oblivious to the reality surrounding them and their own insecurities. False illusion of peace and poisonned relations with friends are their lot while they attempt to spend one last summer as if nothing was happening. Award: Prix Jean Vigo 1979.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Meurisse ; director, Jacques Davila ; writers, Jacques Davila, Marie-France Bonin ; photography, Martial Thury.
Cast: Micheline Presle, Bernadette Lafont, Caroline Cellier, Frederic de Pasquale, Roger Hanin, Martine Sarcey, Gerard Lartigau.

results.title: Cerebral palsy: basic abilities
results.creator_credit: Spastic Centre of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Based on the Book “Cerebral Palsy - Basic Abilities - A plan for Training the Pre-School Child” the film carefully outlines the program used in New South Wales since 1963, in an attempt to develop visuomotor and perceptual learning skills.
results.description: Based on the Book “Cerebral Palsy - Basic Abilities - A plan for Training the Pre-School Child” the film carefully outlines the program used in New South Wales since 1963, in an attempt to develop visuomotor and perceptual learning skills.

results.title: Ceramic glazes
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the mixing of an opaque matt and stone glaze, both showing wide firing latitude and high colour receptivity. Glaze application by several methods is shown. Kiln interiors at intervals during firing show the progressive stages of the glaze.

results.title: Ceramic art of Japan
results.creator_credit: Nihon Eiga Shin-sha and Tokyo National Museum
results.brief_description: Ceramics, the traditional art of hands, clay and fire, began with the making of earthenware. Korean and Chinese influences can be traced in the history of Japanese ceramics but were modified by the existing traditions of the Japanese craftsmen. Exquisite work includes some dating from the ninth century, a tenth century jar with a beautiful ash-blown glaze; tea ceremony bowls of porcelain with plum blossom being used as a popular motif.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nihon Eiga Shin-sha and Tokyo National Museum

results.title: Century of progress
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and V.R. Sarma
results.brief_description: A survey of the Indian Railways, the story of the fulfilment of a 100-year-old dream. April 16, 1953, marked the first centenary of the Indian Railways. In 1853 the first rails were laid between Bombay and Thana. Where once only the hoof-beat of the bullock or pony could be heard, the iron horse now thunders. India now possesses the largest railway system in Asia and the third largest in the world. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and V.R. Sarma

results.title: Century obsession (A)
results.brief_description: ‘Century Obsession’ is a documentary that explores the evolution of body worship over the last 100 years. It questions the notion of how body worship has changed from the worship of each other to the worship of ourselves and how fashion, fitness, culture and even politics have taken an integral part of this transformation. The viewer is taken through a montage of images including beauty in the 1920’s, ‘Muscle Beach’, villages in Africa, Hitler’s Youth Party, fashions of the 60’s and 70’s, Mary Quant, Levi jeans, communist fashion enforced by Chairman Mao, exercise inspired franchises led by Arnold Schwarzenegger and Jane Fonda plus much more. Narrated by Tom Baker.
